application.javafxapp

Class JavaFXAppHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.pane.PaneAnimator.Handler
      • application.javafxapp.JavaFXAppHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PaneReplacer, java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler

    public class JavaFXAppHandler
extends PaneAnimator.Handler
    This Class is made for optimizing the invocations for JavaFXAppController specifically.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public static void handle(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                          java.lang.String pathToFXML)
        This static method makes sure to PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation.
        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.
        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the new scene to be shown.
        See Also:
        PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(ButtonBase)

      • handleOnce

        public static void handleOnce(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                              java.lang.String pathToFXML,
                              boolean handle)
        This static method makes sure to PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation, while enforcing the ButtonBase to be pressed at most once.

        This means, the user should not be able to "spam" click the ButtonBase.

        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.
        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the new scene to be shown.
        handle - Indicates whether to invoke the PaneAnimator.Handler.handle(Event) method or not.
        See Also:
        PaneAnimator.Handler#handleOnce(ButtonBase)

      • handle

        public static void handle(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                          java.lang.String pathToFXML,
                          boolean handle)
        This static method makes sure to PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation.
        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.
        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the new scene to be shown.
        handle - Indicates whether to invoke the PaneAnimator.Handler.handle(Event) method or not.

      • handleOnce

        public static void handleOnce(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                              java.lang.String pathToFXML,
                              java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        This static method makes sure to PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation, while enforcing the ButtonBase to be pressed at most once.

        This means, the user should not be able to "spam" click the ButtonBase.

        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.
        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the new scene to be shown.
        runnable - Stores here a Runnable to invoke its Runnable.run() method, right after invoking the PaneAnimator.Handler.handle(Event)'s body.
        See Also:
        PaneAnimator.Handler#handleOnce(ButtonBase)

      • handleOnce

        public static void handleOnce(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                              java.lang.String pathToFXML,
                              boolean handle,
                              java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        This static method makes sure to PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation, while enforcing the ButtonBase to be pressed at most once.

        This means, the user should not be able to "spam" click the ButtonBase.

        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.
        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the new scene to be shown.
        handle - Indicates whether to invoke the PaneAnimator.Handler.handle(Event) method or not.
        runnable - Stores here a Runnable to invoke its Runnable.run() method, right after invoking the PaneAnimator.Handler.handle(Event)'s body.
        See Also:
        PaneAnimator.Handler#handleOnce(ButtonBase)

        public static void handle(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                          java.lang.String pathToFXML,
                          boolean handle,
                          java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        This static method makes sure to PaneAnimator.Handler#handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation.
